intro: Stylidium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that resemble a trigger mechanism. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually red or orange, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Stylidium diffusum is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to arid environments.
